name: Thumbs Up: Medium Skin Tone
baseMeaning: A thumbs-up gesture indicating approval or agreement.
tldr: Classic approval sign, but Gen Z may read it as passive-aggressive or dismissive.

contextMeanings.meaning: Professional acknowledgment or approval in workplace communication.
Can indicate dismissiveness, annoyance, or fake agreement.
Used to signal 'whatever' or forced acceptance.

platformNotes.note: Common reaction emoji - generally seen as professional and appropriate.
May feel cold or dismissive to younger recipients, especially in personal conversations.
Commonly used as a reaction, less likely to be read as passive-aggressive.

generationalNotes.note: Often perceive it as passive-aggressive, hostile, or dismissive. The 'OK Boomer' of emojis.
Mixed feelings - aware it can seem cold but still use it professionally.
A simple, clear signal of approval with no negative connotations.

warnings.title: Generational divide
warnings.description: Younger people may interpret this as dismissive or passive-aggressive. Consider using words or other emojis with Gen Z.
